abstract: Ben S. Bernanke, the Fed chairman, said the Fed should regulate financial institutions but a council could monitor broader risks.
snippet: Ben S. Bernanke, the Fed chairman, said the Fed should regulate financial institutions but a council could monitor broader risks.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The chairman of the Federal Reserve, Ben S. Bernanke, told skeptical lawmakers on Thursday that the Fed should be put in charge of regulating the nation’s biggest financial institutions.

headline.main: Bernanke, in Nod to Critics, Suggests Board of Regulators
headline.print_headline: Bernanke, in a Bow to Critics of Fed’s Role, Supports Forming a Regulatory Group
